title: torch.bernoulli not supported on Variables of type torch.cuda.FloatTensor
body_html:
This is on master, and I think this used to work before.

torch.bernoulli(torch.cuda.FloatTensor([1])) # works
torch.cuda.FloatTensor([1]).bernoulli() # works

torch.bernoulli(torch.autograd.Variable(torch.cuda.FloatTensor([1])))
# RuntimeError: bernoulli is not implemented for type torch.cuda.FloatTensor

torch.autograd.Variable(torch.cuda.FloatTensor([1])).bernoulli() # fails as well

If the following is expected, it would be nice to have the error message mention that the Variable bit is the problem.

body:
This is on master, and I think this used to work before.

```python
torch.bernoulli(torch.cuda.FloatTensor([1])) # works
torch.cuda.FloatTensor([1]).bernoulli() # works

torch.bernoulli(torch.autograd.Variable(torch.cuda.FloatTensor([1])))
# RuntimeError: bernoulli is not implemented for type torch.cuda.FloatTensor

torch.autograd.Variable(torch.cuda.FloatTensor([1])).bernoulli() # fails as well
```

If the following is expected, it would be nice to have the error message mention that the Variable bit is the problem.
